'''Tranquill''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ハトーボー''' ''Hatoboh'') is a dual-type {{2t|Normal|Flying}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Pidove}} starting at [[level]] 21 and evolves into {{p|Unfezant}} starting at level 32.

==Biology==
Tranquill is an avian Pokémon that is gray with lighter gray and black markings. Its beak and eyes are yellow, and there is dark pink marking above its beak that curves back over the eyes. It has a black tuft of two feathers on its head and a petal-like arrangement of feathers on the nape of its neck. There is a black stripe on each of its light gray, black-tipped wings. Each pink foot has black talons. It possesses a long tail feather that is tipped in black. No matter how far a Tranquill travels, it is always able to return to its Trainer. It is said to live in deep forests, where there is a peaceful place without war.

==In the anime==
[[File:Trip Tranquill.png|250px|thumb|left|Tranquill in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Ash's Tranquill]]====
During the events of ''[[BW022|A Venipede Stampede!]]'', {{Ash}}'s {{p|Pidove}} evolved into Tranquill after helping to clear a swarm of {{p|Venipede}} out of [[Castelia City]]. She evolved into Unfezant in ''[[BW068|An Amazing Aerial Battle!]]''.

====Other====
A Tranquill owned by [[Trip]] appeared in ''[[BW010|A Rival Battle for Club Champ!]]'', which was also the species' debut appearance. It was used in Trip's 5-on-5 battle against {{Ash}}; it battled {{AP|Tepig}} and {{AP|Oshawott}} defeating the both of them before losing to {{AP|Pikachu}}. It later reappeared in ''[[BW022|A Venipede Stampede!]]'' where it assisted in clearing the swarm of Venipede.

A flock of Tranquill appeared in ''[[BW044|Purrloin: Sweet or Sneaky?]]''. They were angry at Purrloin for stealing their Berries, until he pleaded for forgiveness so that they would save Ash, {{an|Iris}}, {{MTR}}, the other Pokémon, and his Trainer, [[Misha]], from a sand pit.

===Minor appearances===
A Trainer's Tranquill briefly appeared in ''[[BW010|A Rival Battle for Club Champ!]]'' as an image on a computer screen in the [[Luxuria Town]] [[Battle Club]].

[[Antonio]] owns a Tranquill, which he used in ''[[BW039|Reunion Battles In Nimbasa!]]'' to advance to the second round in the [[Club Battle]] by defeating [[Emmanuel]] and his {{p|Scolipede}}. [[Dino]] also used a Tranquill in the same episode, defeating Antonio's {{p|Cottonee}} to advance to the third round.

Multiple Tranquill made cameo appearances in ''[[BW059|Stopping the Rage of Legends! Part 1]]'' and ''[[BW069|Climbing the Tower of Success!]]''.

Multiple Tranquill appeared in ''[[M15|Kyurem VS. The Sword of Justice]]'', during the {{OBP|Swords of Justice|M15}} legend.

==Trivia==
* Tranquill is the only Pokémon with a base stat total of 358.

===Origin===
Judging from its Pokédex entries, Tranquill may be based on a {{wp|Columbidae|dove}}, often used as a symbol of peace, and possibly a {{wp|homing pigeon}}, a domestic pigeon bred to find its way home over extremely long distances. Its design is similar to that of the {{wp|greater roadrunner}} or {{wp|secretarybird}}.

====Name origin====
Tranquill is a combination of ''tranquil'' (calm or unstressed) and ''quill'' (a feather from the tail of a bird). It also involves ''{{wp|Coturnix|quail}}''.

Hatoboh may be a combination of 鳩 ''hato'' (pigeon) and 逃亡 ''tōbō'' (escape) or 尨 'bō' (shaggy hair). Additionally, some of the works of {{wp|Kenji Miyazawa}} mention a fictional ideal world called 「イーハトーヴォ」 ''Ihatov''. The Pokédex entry in {{game3|Black and White|Pokémon White|s}} says, "Many people believe that, deep in the forest where Tranquill live, there is a peaceful place where there is no war," which might be a reference to Kenji's utopia.
